state.code:
graph TD
    subgraph User
        A[User] --> B[Accesses Web Browser]
    end

    subgraph Application
        C[SPA URL: https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/spa] --> D[SPA]
    end

    subgraph Interaction
        B --> D
        D --> E[User Interaction]
        D --> F[Server Communication]
    end

    subgraph Server
        F --> G[Server]
        G --> H[Server Response]
        H --> F
    end

User --(Accesses Web Browser)--> Accesses Web Browser
Accesses Web Browser --(Opens SPA URL: https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/spa)--> SPA
Accesses Web Browser --(SPA)--> User Interaction
SPA --(User Interaction)--> Server Communication
Server Communication --(Server)--> Server Response
Server Response --(Server Response)--> Server Communication
User Interaction --(User Interaction)--> SPA

5. [Accesses Web Browser] --> 6. [SPA]

6. --> 8. [Server Communication]
8. --> 9. [Server]
9. --> 10. [Server Response]

7. --> 6

sequenceDiagram
    participant browser
    participant server

    browser->>server: POST 
    activate server
    server-->>browser: HTML document
    deactivate server

    browser->>server: GET https://studies.sequenceDiagram
    participant browser
    participant server
    Note right of browser: The user writes the note "too easy" and press save button in browser
    browser->>server: HTTP POST {"content": "too easy", "date": "2023-11-9"} 
    activate server
    Note left of server: The server saves te note and ask to the browser for a new request of notes page
    server-->>browser: Response 302
    deactivate server

    Note right of browser: The browser recharge the note page and ask for the resources to the server
    browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.css
    activate server
    server-->>browser: the Css file
    deactivate server

    browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.js
    activate server
    server-->>browser: the JavaScript file
    deactivate server

    Note right of browser: The browser starts executing the JavaScript code that fetches the JSON from the server

    browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/data.json
    activate server
    server-->>browser: [{ "content": "too easy", "date": "2023-11-9" }, ... ]
    deactivate server

    Note right of browser: The browser executes the callback function that renders the notes.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.css
    activate server
    server-->>browser: the css file
    deactivate server

    browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/main.js
    activate server
    server-->>browser: the JavaScript file
    deactivate server

    Note right of browser: The browser starts executing the JavaScript code that fetches the JSON from the server

    browser->>server: GET https://studies.cs.helsinki.fi/exampleapp/data.json
    activate server
    server-->>browser: [{ "content": "HTML is easy", "date": "2023-1-1" }, ... ]
    deactivate server

    Note right of browser: The browser executes the callback function that renders the notes
